Title: Vice President, Research and Science
Post_Date: # an unknown date more than 30 days ago
Description:
Overview

The Pew Charitable Trusts is driven by the power of knowledge to solve today’s most challenging problems. Pew applies a rigorous, analytical approach to improve public policy, inform the public and invigorate civic life.

We are an independent nonprofit organization – the sole beneficiary of seven individual trusts established between 1948 and 1979 by two sons and two daughters of Sun Oil Company founder Joseph N. Pew and his wife, Mary Anderson Pew.

Our work lays the foundation for effective policy solutions by informing and engaging citizens, linking diverse interests to pursue common cause and insisting on tangible results. Our projects encourage efficient, responsive governments – at the local, state, national and international levels – serving the best interests of the people. We partner with a diverse range of donors, public and private organizations and concerned citizens who share our interest in fact-based solutions and goal-driven investments to improve society.

With offices in Philadelphia, Washington DC, Australia, Brussels and London, and with additional staff in other regions of the United States and around the globe, Pew provides an exciting learning environment and the opportunity to work with highly talented individuals. We are a dynamic, rapidly evolving organization that values creativity and innovative thinking and fosters strong teamwork with mutual respect.

Position Overview
The vice president, research and science, is responsible for enhancing the quality and impact of the research conducted within Pew’s five program portfolios (environment Americas, environment international, federal government performance, Philadelphia, and state and local government performance), with an eye toward producing quality research products. The vice president leads the research and science portfolio, with oversight responsibility for Pew’s overall research review process, and also oversees specific research and science projects, where Pew both conducts and supports research on priority topics.

To this end, the vice president leverages the strengths of the combined research team; helps craft research findings that inform policy reform and implementation; champions the value of research throughout the organization; coordinates with other members of the senior management team to ensure research integrity across all projects; manages the research review process that works to ensure the quality of deliverables for research projects across Pew; seeks to apply research in various fields in ways that advance public policy reform; identifies opportunities to support and enhance existing systems and processes to equip program teams for success; and continues to foster a research community within Pew.

The vice president also oversees the program coordination and services function, which coordinates program-wide engagement with operations units, oversees key crosscutting program functions, and manages the program executive team, which supports the executive vice president and chief program officer.

The vice president reports to the executive vice president and chief program officer. She or he will work in partnership with other vice presidents to foster collaboration amongst program initiatives and teams; realize synergies; and ensure efficient, effective, and uniform processes and practices for both quality research and effective operational needs are in place and utilized across the program units. The vice president sits on the leadership team for the institution and is a member of program’s senior management team, which is comprised of the executive vice president, six vice presidents, and five senior directors.

The research and science portfolio includes several project and support teams that house nearly 70 staff, including:
The Pew Scholars Program in the Biomedical Sciences, which provides funding to young investigators of outstanding promise in science relevant to the advancement of human health. The program makes grants to selected academic institutions to support the independent research of outstanding individuals who are in their first few years of their appointment at the assistant professor level.
The Lenfest Ocean Program, a grantmaking program that funds scientific research on policy-relevant topics concerning the world’s oceans and communicates the results of the supported research to decision-makers and other interested audiences.
The Pew Fellows Program in Marine Conservation, which seeks to improve ocean health by generating high-quality research and fostering a global community of experts who collaborate to address marine conservation issues.
Conservation science, which supports and manages environmental research projects in partnership with Pew’s broader environmental portfolios and provides in-depth expertise in the development and support of new environmental research efforts.
Pew’s fiscal federalism initiatives, which conduct research addressing the relationship between federal, state, local policies, and budgets on topics of shared interest and responsibility. These areas include such topics as broadband connectivity, higher education, natural disaster (response and preparedness), and student loan research.
Stateline, Pew’s digital newspaper that provides daily reporting and analysis on trends in state policy, is a team of veteran journalists that combines original reporting with a roundup of the latest news from sources around the country. Stateline focuses on four topics that are key to state policy: demographics, fiscal and economic issues, health care, and the business of government.
Research review and support (RRS), a group of experienced researchers and analysts that carries out the research review process that works to ensure quality research across Pew. RRS helps project teams design and implement high-quality research reports, studies, issue briefs, surveys, and other data-driven research; validates research quality for all projects from initial proposal through to the post-analysis data checks; advises project teams on methodological or analytical questions; and provides research assistance.
Program coordination and services, a team that works to ensure effective management systems across the program department and coordinates with other operating departments (communications, finance, government relations, human resources, legal, and workplace services) to achieve program objectives.
Program executive team, which prioritizes, facilitates, and coordinates workflow and communications between the executive vice president and other departments, including the president and CEO, program leadership, and external partners to ensure the smooth running of the executive vice president and chief program officer’s office.


Responsibilities

Identify and implement strategies to inform policy change through applied research.
Work with project teams across Pew to design, manage, and deliver rigorous, fact-based research that explores board-approved policy issues in order to have national and international impact. Work with teams to develop research and survey approaches that answer relevant policy questions and are conducted in a high-quality, rigorous, and timely manner.
Conceptualize and design the research methods used for a variety of research products, including empirical analysis, compilation and analysis of data sets, and literature reviews. Maintain and develop a broad technical knowledge of research methodologies.
Maintain research and survey review and tracking processes that are responsive to Pew’s commitment to high-quality research. Modify the research and survey review processes as necessary and ensure that any changes are communicated across the institution.
Collaborate with program teams on the development of written reports and other research products that are highly relevant to policy deliberations and easily understood by the public, media, and policymakers. Collaborate with Pew’s communications unit, external writers, and other consultants as necessary to ensure a broad audience that reaches key stakeholders.
Engage regularly with significant organizations and professional associations. Understand the conditions and dynamics in general research approaches and developments and issues in his/her specific discipline or field. Know the major players and why they are significant. Maintain a productive network of leading researchers in the public policy, economics, health care, and environmental arenas.
Lead Pew’s efforts to broaden and deepen the evidence-based policymaking field. Participate in conferences, seminars, and other professional development activities. Represent Pew at public forums and in front of key audiences.
Collaborate with partners within program and the other operations departments to improve coordination across program and operating units, including, for example, identifying and addressing issues related to grants management and assessing training needs at all levels of project management.
Lead the work of the teams listed above and set their strategic direction in coordination with the executive vice president. Oversee the work and development of research and science staff. Assist project directors within research and science in the development and monitoring of program budgets.
Manage and mentor staff, including overseeing managers with junior staff.
Contribute to and participate in tasks of the department as assigned. Participate in Pew-wide projects as requested.
Serve as a member of the program leadership team.
Requirements

Bachelor’s degree required and advanced degree or Ph.D. and research experience strongly preferred.
A minimum of 15 years of senior leadership experience in an academic or public policy setting required.
Minimum of 10 years of previous direct supervisory experience required, including experience managing performance management processes for direct reports and providing career development advice and counsel.
Specialized technical expertise in a field relevant to Pew’s public policy priorities, which include economics, public finance, econometric analysis, conservation, and health preferred. Recognized authority in area of expertise or has played a leadership role in a specialized area.
Expertise in research design and skilled in higher-order quantitative and qualitative research methods. Extensive familiarity with a wide variety of data sources, as well as sources of sound advice for research design.
Expertise and up-to-date awareness of research review processes and associated software products, and expertise to make them usable by Pew researchers.
Broad understanding of domestic and/or international policy and keen awareness and/or experience with using research and data to inform policy.
A strong network of relevant contacts that can provide expert information, analysis, and advice to advance results. Able to leverage relationships to influence positive outcomes. Excellent knowledge of the current trends, principal theories, leading thinkers, and major concerns within portfolio area.
A strong results orientation, with a track record of solving problems creatively. A strong commitment to producing measurable results.
Ability to navigate a complex institution and to develop strong internal relationships. Seasoned judgment; able to make decisions, justify recommendations, and be responsive, clear, and firm with colleagues and partners.
Excellent analytic and problem-solving skills. Ability to synthesize large amounts of information and to focus quickly on the essence of an issue/problem, determine whether it is ripe for intervention, and identify the means to address it.
Strong interpersonal skills. An excellent listener who can work productively and diplomatically with a wide array of different people and institutions that frequently disagree with and are in competition with one another. Excellent written and oral communications skills. Expertise as an editor.
Excellent time and project management skills. Highly flexible, with the ability to juggle multiple priorities, adjust to changing circumstances, remain attentive to details, and identify resources for projects.
Ability to fit into Pew’s nonpartisan, creative, fast-paced, and highly professional corporate culture, which emphasizes excellence, collegiality, and teamwork.
Ability to analyze budgetary information and assess organizational capacity.

Travel
Occasional day and overnight travel, including some international, throughout the year.

Total Rewards
We offer a competitive salary and benefit program, including: comprehensive, affordable health care through medical, dental, and vision coverage; financial security with life and disability insurance; opportunities to save using health savings and flexible spending accounts; retirement benefits to help prepare for the future; and work/life benefits to maintain a good balance.

Equal Employer Opportunity (EEO) Statement
The Pew Charitable Trusts is an equal opportunity employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Pew considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to age, sex, ethnicity, religion, disability, marital status, sexual orientation or gender identity, military/veteran status, or any other basis prohibited by applicable law.

Title: Staff Writer, Transportation and Infrastructure - CQ Roll Call
Description:
Introduction



Washington’s CQ Roll Call brings up-to-date news, analysis and insights to senior decision-makers on Capitol Hill. This trusted source of unbiased, impartial information provides authoritative, nonpartisan and accurate congressional news and legislative tracking tools to its subscribers. Through more than 40 print and online products, CQ Roll Call keeps readers updated on a weekly, daily and real-time basis covering every legislative action in Congress with breaking news, bill tracking, and member profiles and offers insight on the people and institutions that influence public policy and legislation.

CQ Roll Call seeks a staff writer with expertise in transportation and infrastructure to cover legislation and policy development, lobbying and politics related to the industry.

The Transportation and Infrastructure staff writer, based in Washington, D.C., will be responsible for covering hearings, bill markups, floor action and other events of interest as stakeholders advance their interests in Congress. The beat broadly includes coverage of airlines, automobiles, railroads, ports and shipping, and the infrastructure that supports them. The journalist would be required to look beyond the Beltway at trends in state policy, their outcomes and impact on stakeholders.

CQ offers the successful candidate a chance to write for our core website, newsletters and magazine, plus contribute to Roll Call, record podcasts, appear as an expert at events and with outside media, and participate in the newsroom's growth initiatives.
Accountabilities
In the role you would be expected to:
Track and understand legislation, including appropriations bills that allocate funding to the Department of Transportation and other relevant agencies
Generate story ideas and analysis for a sophisticated audience that includes government, corporations, associations and trade groups
Develop sources on and off Capitol Hill, including in trade groups and lobbying shops
Experience, skills and professional attributes
To succeed in the role you must have:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience
Attention to detail, industry knowledge and the ability to create and interpret data for trend stories are a must
At least five years of experience covering Congress or transportation and infrastructure, and demonstrate an ability to mine legislation, lobbying and campaign spending reports, and regulatory filings for incisive stories that connect the dots
Strong writing and reporting skills; sources in the industry, K Street and federal agencies; and experience in breaking stories.
Applicants should be able to write clearly and quickly
Applicants should be able to write spot news as well as features and longer-form analysis, including data-driven stories; amplify their work on social media, and demonstrate an ability to raise the newsroom’s profile and reach

To succeed in the role you will be able to demonstrate:
A collaborative work style and the ability to be a team player with other CQ reporters and editors
Flexibility and an ability to adapt to change as well as a high degree of accuracy and fairness, as well as correct grammar and spelling
A strong work ethic and a willingness to adapt to changing news situations, including to work odd hours when news happens
Ability to meet deadlines and ensure that copy is free of misspellings, style errors or mistakes
Ability to work with editors to develop story ideas, schedule them and deliver them on time while keeping in close touch with editors about developments on news beat

Title: Associate Director, Global Communications

Description:
Background/IRC Summary:
More than 80 years after Albert Einstein helped create the International Rescue Committee, the number and intensity of humanitarian crises across the globe warrant a dose of Einstein-inspired vision.
Every month, nearly one million people flee their homes because of conflicts or natural disasters. With few wars ending, and new wars starting, the number of people displaced by conflict has reached nearly 60 million, the most since World War II. Their growing and increasingly complex needs mandate a transformation—a creative rethinking—in the global humanitarian response.

Job Overview/Job Summary:

As a key member of the IRC's Global Communications Team, the Associate Director, Global Communications will develop and execute communications strategies positioning the IRC as the thought and practice leader of the humanitarian sector, with a focus on our international programs, reaching US audiences through top tier US media and earned channels.
The Associate Director will lead the International Programs, U.S. Communications Unit and drive annual strategy and prioritization processes, responding to changes to IRC’s context and the external communications landscape in the U.S..
This position is based at the IRC's headquarters in New York with some travel expected. The Associate Director will act as a spokesperson as needed, and manage at least one communications colleague.

Major Responsibilities: Lead on annual strategic prioritization processes to deliver strategic proactive US communications and media relations, leveraging IRC's global insights and programming to secure top tier US media results, including counter-intuitive “earned” outlets that will help IRC's story and message cut-through to defined strategic audiences. Convene, lead, and build deep relationships and understanding with a broad range of internal IRC stakeholders that support and have a stake in U.S. communications regarding IRC’s international programs in over thirty countries: Including regional and country program teams, technical unit experts, U.N. and U.S. aligned advocates, nationwide IRC fundraisers and marketers. Collaborate with IRC departments to create powerful communications products that can be the center-piece for proactive “tent-pole” moments, tied to the external landscape that IRC is seeking to influence Drive “whole of organization” profiles of the IRC, leveraging IRC’s unique footprint across the arc of refugee crises, from war-zones, to Europe, and to the U.S.. Provide surge support – both strategic and tactical - on crisis communications, as well as reputational / issues management Deploy excellent coaching, analytical, and writing skills that deliver: killer communications strategies; pitches that land IRC-led features; high-level IRC messages for cross-organizational use; top tier landing op-eds; and talking points for spokespeople. Represent the IRC as a spokesperson to external and internal audiences, both via media interviews and contributing to digital content. Partner with Digital Content and Communications to coordinate digital content aligning to proactive “earned” moments, working closely with digital communication technical specialists on distribution and measurement as appropriate. Produce quarterly reports on coverage and communications results using industry standard metrics and bench-marking, and refine target U.S. audiences and IRC’s target outlets to reach those audiences Strengthen / develop internal systems and processes to deliver on communications objectives. Step in as needed in emergency moments with flexibility and an ability to pick up new tracks of work and issues quickly Deliver and lead executive communications for IRC's international program leaders, including supporting annual CEO communications strategies and planning Expand and nurture IRC’s communications network.

Experience in coaching, producing and editing, under tight-deadlines, delivering accurate and dynamic communications materials including press-releases, op-eds, talking points and digital content. COMPANY DESCRIPTION
SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

Global Corporate Affairs (GCA) is responsible for SAP's corporate reputation, communications, government relations and corporate social responsibility. The team develops strategic messaging and corporate content and engages vital audiences in dialogue to advance SAP’s position as one of the largest and fastest growing cloud companies in the world.

This position will play a key role on GCA’s North America Communications team, acting as the integrated communications lead for the West market unit in the United States and driving the strategy and direction for overall communications in Silicon Valley, a strategic innovation and sales region for SAP. The ideal candidate is a rock star communicator who will own, develop, manage, and execute all corporate communications activities and plans for the Western United States and Silicon Valley. The position will be supported by the broader North America Communications team.

The candidate in this role will constantly challenge and improve the effectiveness of SAP’s strategic communications functions and activities across the region.

Develop, maintain, and execute an ongoing strategic communications plan to continue to promote and position SAP as the leader in its industry. Must develop a clear understanding of the goals and business objectives of the company and align all communications programs to the company’s overall strategic business plan in North America.

This is a hands-on, individual contributor role that requires strong leadership and the ability to manage and lead cross-functional teams. Requires strategic vision coupled with the ability to create and execute tactical deliverables on a daily basis. Must be a PR machine who loves to pitch reporters and get your hands dirty on Corporate Communications projects.

Partner closely with other corporate functions in each market unit to ensure fully-integrated efforts.

Media Relations
Deliver annual communications plans, manage PR agencies and provide communications counsel to local Managing Director and executives in that market unit.

Work with Sales Leadership to deliver thought leadership and messaging to position SAP with all key stakeholders and engage in collaborative discussion with key external communities.

Ensure a strong rolling volume of media coverage and strong message penetration around all market categories and industry verticals.

Build, own and nurture relationships with key journalists.

Ensure crisis communications events are managed, coordinated and escalated to regional and global communications leaders when necessary.

Employee Communications
Consistently deliver communications based on change management priorities and advocate for the information needs of employees.

Manage internal communications that focuses on consistent and engaging messaging for employees – working closely with HR and local business leaders based on the company business plan and company vision to create consistent key messages.

Enable employee engagement through regular communication channels and work with regional teams to provide content for quarterly company updates or Town Hall meetings.

Executive Communications
Secure appropriate speaking and engagement opportunities for executives.

Produce and review content for executives and respective management leaders as appropriate, including speeches, internal memos, press releases, white papers, keynote presentations, and important stakeholder correspondences.

Requires BA/BS in Communications, Journalism, PR, Business, or Marketing

5-7+ years of related experience developing and driving successful and comprehensive communications plans.

Successful candidate must be based in the San Francisco Bay Area.

Experience managing and partnering with external PR agencies.

Ability to lead teams and prioritize according to changing business priorities.

Ability to grasp aspects of the business, technical issues and market considerations; software industry and technollgy experience preferred, but not required.

Proven track record of implementing successful media relations programs in fast-paced, entrepreneurial environments.

Excellent written and oral communications skills.

Strong interpersonal/human relations/management skills for dealing with senior management and coordinating projects with internal contacts and outside vendors.

Proven ability to handle executive level interaction and influence executive thought leadership.

Ability to work with composure under pressure and to manage multiple, concurrent tasks and projects.

Flexible and resilient. Problem solver. Critical thinker. Ability to gain consensus among others. Ability to manage sensitive situations.

Requires ability to work in cross-cultural environment and willingness to travel on a frequent basis.

The ideal candidate must be an outstanding professional who is passionate about communications. He/she must have proven media relations skills and employee communications experience.

This individual will be a dynamic business manager and a world-class communications professional, who can motivate, lead others, and work with cross-functional teams in a heavily-matrixed environment.

He/she must have outstanding strategic planning skills, a solid understanding of business relationships, and the knowledge, intellect and temperament to work at the highest levels in a corporate environment. A high degree of personal initiative, as well as outstanding interpersonal, collaboration, listening, verbal, written communications and process facilitation skills, are absolutes.

Must exhibit the ability to work in an evolving environment and balance the needs of various internal and external stakeholders; high tolerance for rapid change and stress; flexibility and steady temperament. Tolerance for ambiguity. Must be collaborative in nature and capable of building consensus and strong working relationships within a matrix organizational structure. SAP encourages a team environment and the attributes of humbleness combined with confidence express that sentiment.

This person should be innately creative and flexible in nature. It is equally important that he/she be a “roll up your sleeves” contributor. Absolutes are a proven ability to effectively, see through implementation, manage high-profile communications, with the ability to make sound judgments and produce compelling content quickly.

Candidate must possess strengths in understanding communications strategies that support driving internal cultural change towards a high-performance environment.

A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

Title: Head of Marketing - Content (Global)
Post_Date: # an unknown date more than 30 days ago
Description:
Job Title:


Head of Marketing - Content (Global)

Job type:


Permanent

Location:


London or Houston

Reporting Relationship:
 Global Head of Marketing

Argus is a fast-growing global B2B media company providing essential information on commodity markets. As a business, we continue to grow and evolve, adding new markets, new services, new delivery options and improved analytical tools.

Job Purpose
Our global Marketing team are currently seeking self-motivated, results focused, detail-oriented marketing professionals in London, Houston, Singapore and Moscow. This is a great opportunity for those individuals who thrive on deploying both the art and science of marketing to drive aggressive revenue growth. We are currently a £150 million brand leader looking to take Argus to the next level.

We are looking for individuals who are self-motivated and radiate a can-do positive energy, capable in working through ambiguity to deliver marketing campaigns that build the brand and explicitly produce high quality sales leads.
In this newly created role, as the Head of Marketing, Content, you will have a leading part to play in a newly restructured global marketing team. This is a great career-making opportunity to deliver major results at Argus.

Due to the global nature of this role, it can be based out of Houston or London depending on your location.

Key responsibilities

Manage a team of 10+ content development professionals to create marketing campaigns that resonate with target audiences, as demonstrated by high click-through and conversion-to-revenue tracking metrics
Lead the process by which the content development team remains continuously up-to-date on historical, late-breaking or otherwise important trends impacting each industry and their buyer personas
Build a process by which the content development team continuously experiments and tests thought leadership formats and multiple calls-to-action (CTAs) to increase the quality and quantity of sales
Responsible for defining customer journeys, developing nurture strategies and program, as well as continuously improving customer engagement metrics
Build a process by which the content development team define and link (1) buyer personas with (2) co-marketing partners and list-acquisition opportunities to aggressively expand market reach, micro-targeting and role-specific messaging to accelerate demand
Create a nimble culture in which the content development team can quickly produce thought leadership and sales lead generation campaigns that capitalize on fast-breaking market trends or movements in such a way as to produce and launch timely and topical marketing campaigns that help illuminate an otherwise opaque marketplace
Implement (with the Traffic Coordinator) processes by which the Content Development team proactively communicates new content/campaigns to Moscow and Singapore regions as soon as possible, and determine (1) what extent to which they wish to repurpose/localize the content and (2) streamline processes that divide certain workflows (e.g. repurposing calls-to-action, messaging, translations) that should be done by independently by the Singapore or Moscow office.
Project a can-do and assertive leadership approach that (1) produces sector-specific Marketing Plans that articulate how (2) strong revenue growth will be achieved by each business unit.
Coach, mentor and develop the team.

Essential elements of the role

Hire, train and manage top content development talent capable of interviewing stakeholders, leading brainstorming sessions, building strong industry relationships and writing content that inspires the reader to engage with our sales funnel
Produce a continuous stream of high quality marketing campaign content that is then “handed off” to the Production Team for repurposing and distribution across all available channels
Continuously identify thought leadership that elevates Argus’ brand in the marketplace, while mechanically making it easy for prospects to enter our sales funnel
Coach the content development team on how to create each sector’s team of “knowledge leaders” who can be tapped to review (and sometimes write) content that will stand-out as particularly strong in illuminating markets often seen as opaque.
Identify underperforming working practices and processes and escalate for corrective action
Be a contributor to the ever-present need to improve people, information and technology to create both a rewarding career experience that also delivers aggressive revenue growth

An exciting career move if you:

Have extensive content development leadership experience within in a B2B information provider, commodities industry experience a plus
Are commercially driven and ambitious to prove the ROI of marketing campaigns
Are pragmatic and good at building strong relationships across a number of teams, including with Sales and with content experts
Possess excellent written skills and know how to motivate your team to achieve high standards in the work they produce
Don’t like to be micro-managed: you are self-directed to continuously adapt to achieve strategic goals
Can deliver and accept constructive criticism in a collegial, team-based environment
Enjoy a fluid, fast-paced, entrepreneurial work environment
Have high attention to detail and produce quality work in a timely manner
Are willing to work with people at all levels of the organization—from the CEO to the interns
Thrive on picking up the phone, not overly relying on email, to build substantive relationships
Are excited to solve problems from start to finish: identify causes, recommend solution, and implement
Believe in Passion, Integrity, Excellence and Results

About Argus Media

Argus is a leading energy and commodity price reporting agency providing data, news and insight as well as conference and consulting services. Companies in more than 140 countries around the world use Argus prices to index physical trade and as benchmarks in financial derivative markets as well as for analysis and planning purposes.

Half of Argus' 900 employees are commodity journalists who specialise in reporting news and price information relating to physical energy and related commodity markets. They operate according to a rigorous Editorial Code of Conduct and a Compliance and Ethics Policy that align with best journalistic practice, including the avoidance of conflicts of interest.

Argus was founded in 1970 and is a privately held UK-registered company. It is owned by staff shareholders and global growth equity firm General Atlantic.

Benefits

Our rapidly-growing, award winning business offers a dynamic environment for talented, entrepreneurial professionals to achieve results and grow their careers. Argus recognises and rewards successful performance and as an Investor in People, we promote professional development and retain a high-performing team committed to building our success.

Competitive salary and company bonus scheme
Group pension scheme
Group healthcare scheme
Subsidised gym membership
Extensive internal and external training

Apply

If this aligns with your next career move, we’d love to hear from you.

Apply via our website www.argusmedia.com/en/careers/open-positions

The New York Times is looking for an Application Security Analyst with strong analytical, critical thinking and decision making skills. 3+ years of relevant security experience.
Strong analytical, critical thinking and decision making skills.
Fundamental understanding of web application architecture and cloud environments.
Fundamental understanding of common mobile and web application vulnerabilities.
Proficient in technical writing and able to communicate effectively.

Is responsible for ensuring that the advance work, logistics and material preparation for press events is completed. Cultivates national media representatives and coordinates our work with other environmental or public interest groups as appropriate. Pitches Sierra Club stories, statements, events and reactions to the press. Conducts media trainings for field, chapter staff and volunteer activists with the Sierra Club Training Academy. Works closely with the Deputy Communications Director, Conservation Managers, and Department Directors on implementing national media work.

Job Activities:

Provides strategic communications guidance for the campaign region. Identifies media opportunities and implements media plans and strategies to promote conservation priorities in print, broadcast and electronic media with volunteers and regional staff in local, regional and national media outlets.
Provides technical guidance to staff and volunteers in the discharge of their media relations responsibilities. Coordinates communications strategies with other regional conservation organizations.
Collaborates with Communications staff on carrying out timely and coordinated Club response to breaking environmental news events.
Contributes to staff strategy meetings, and stays current on substantive and political developments in major conservation campaigns by reading latest literature, attending meetings and maintaining contact with relevant sources.
Supervises, directs, develops, and provides general and technical guidance to staff. Includes the following supervisory responsibilities:
assigns work and establishes standards and work priorities;
ensures staff training and development of employee skills;
provides ongoing performance feedback, prepares, and conducts formal performance planning and evaluation;
recommends salary, hiring, and promotion decisions.
Participates in the development and implementation of local, regional and national communications plan, and coordinates regional media crisis management.
Works to cultivate, and provides service to, local, regional and national media contacts.
Assures preparation of timely and effective communications materials, working with writer/editor and policy staff.
Performs research and analysis using a variety of resources to craft appropriate media messages and materials, including writing news releases, statements, letters to the editor, op-eds and other materials as required for field work and regional media on the Beyond Coal campaign and related legislative issues.
Works with local communities and Club field organizers to gather stories in various platforms – photos, videos, and print for possible future dissemination.
Develops web content and utilizes social media tools including Facebook and Twitter to expand the reach of campaign messages.
Performs miscellaneous duties as required.
Knowledge & Skills:

5 years experience in media relations, with some background in grassroots organizing and staff supervision.
Bachelor's degree in Communications, Journalism, Political Science or related field or combination of education and experience.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Knowledge and experience working in the rapidly changing world of media, including new media platforms and technologies, with focus on the needs of journalists, bloggers and media featuring user generated content and how to get stories placed.
Ability to work well with volunteers.
Ability to work well under pressure, juggle competing demands and maintain good working relations with staff and media. Able to work effectively as a team player.
Working knowledge of environmental issues, environmental policy and the federal electoral and legislative process.

Title: Program and Communications Manager
Post_Date: # an unknown date more than 30 days ago
Description:
Desired: Adobe Creative SuiteMicrosoft WordWordPressMicrosoft OfficeExcelMicrosoft PowerpointThe Institute for Religion, Culture and Public Life supports academic research, teaching, and scholarship on the study of religion, culture, and social difference at Columbia University. In addition, it convenes academic conferences, public forums, and collaborative programming to support and extend academic and scholarly understanding of these topics, and to disseminate and distribute such new understandings to broader publics and communities.

The Institute actively supports scholarship, teaching and public programming across the Faculty of Arts and Sciences as well as in the University more broadly under the auspices and oversight of the Department of Religion.

The successful applicant will demonstrate an interest in academic research and scholarship on the study of religion and public life. Reporting to the Associate Director, the Program Manager works collaboratively with the IRCPL team to support the successful execution of the IRCPL mission. They interact with a wide variety of constituents including faculty, staff, students, external partners, donors, and the general public, often as the first and primary point of contact for media, programs and events. The position requires some evening and weekend work associated with IRCPL events, and the possibility of occasional travel.

The successful applicant will assist in managing IRCPL communications and programs.

1) The Program and Communications Manager will work with the IRCPL team to design and implement programming related to the study of religion and public life. Institute programming includes speaker series, panels, conferences, workshops, research trainings, and meetings with academics, journalists, political figures, students, and others. They conduct outreach to speakers, help with managing event budgets in collaboration with the Business and Operations Manager and the Associate Director, and oversee the implementation of event planning, logistics and publicity.In addition, the Program Manager will support the Associate Director in the general oversight of Institute fellowship and joint project competitions. The Program Manager supports program and event activities, including the following: preparing event agendas and timelines; developing and managing event correspondence, guest lists, and event registration; researching and securing venues and making other logistical arrangements; providing on-site support including setup and breakdown, and conducting background research, and preparing other materials.

2) The Program and Communications Manager will support the implementation and execution of a communications strategy; including the drafting press releases, newsletters, and informational brochures; regularly managing and updating the Institute website and social media; maintaining IRCPL digital mailing lists; and responding to inquiries and escalate to the Director or Associate Director as needed.

3) The Program and Communications Manager drafts flyers, programs, advertisements, reports, publicity materials, and online messaging for the Institute in both print and digital form. He or she supports the development of event outputs such as video documentation and podcasts, including direct coordination with professional videographers for production and execution. In addition, they will contribute to the mailing lists and outreach activities, as well as supporting the Director and Associate Director in liaising with marketing and communications peers throughout Columbia, New York City, and beyond to ensure wide distribution of event announcements and other communications. In addition, the Program and Communications Manager performs other duties as assigned.

Title: Politics Editor (Editor in Charge)
Description:
Job Description
Reuters, the news and media division of Thomson Reuters, is the world’s largest international multimedia news provider reaching more than one billion people every day. Reuters provides trusted business, financial, national, and international news to professionals via Thomson Reuters desktops, the world's media organizations, and directly to consumers at Reuters.com.

Reuters is looking for an excellent journalist for the role of Politics Editor in our Washington bureau. The editor will take on some of the biggest stories in the world as Donald Trump overhauls U.S. policies almost across the board - from trade and diplomacy to immigration and regulation – and the presidency itself. The populist real estate billionaire has already dramatically changed politics and U.S. relationships with allies and enemies around the world. The Trump-Russia investigation, power struggles inside the White House, and Trump’s volatile relations with lawmakers, business executives and world leaders will all determine whether he succeeds or fails.

We are looking for someone with a deep understanding of politics, policy and business, and can work well with reporters to drive our daily news coverage and enterprise reporting on these important stories. The editor, who will report to the Washington Bureau Chief, will also have a major role in designing and executing our coverage of the 2020 presidential election.

Requirements:
A track record of reporting and writing ambitious, exclusive and high-impact stories
Ability to cultivate sources and gain access to exclusive documents
Strong news judgement and excellent editing skills
Leadership experience and ability to work collaboratively across teams and geographies
Understanding of multimedia elements to enhance stories, from graphics to pictures and video

At Thomson Reuters, we believe what we do matters. We are passionate about our work, inspired by the impact it has on our business and our customers. As a team, we believe in winning as one - collaborating to reach shared goals, and developing through challenging and meaningful experiences. With more than 25,000 employees in more than 100 countries, we work flexibly across boundaries and realize innovations that help shape industries around the world. Making this happen is a dynamic, evolving process, and we count on each employee to be a catalyst in driving our performance - and their own.

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under country or local law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.
Intrigued by a challenge as large and fascinating as the world itself? Come join us.

To learn more about what we offer, please visit thomsonreuters.com/careers.

More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on thomsonreuters.com.

Locations
Washington-District of Columbia-United States of America

Title: Director of Strategic Communications and Marketing
Description:
Job Announcement
Director of Strategic Communications and Marketing
The Middle East Broadcasting Networks, Inc. (MBN) is seeking a creative communications professional to define and continually enhance MBN’s market position. MBN is a non-profit, multimedia broadcaster in Springfield, VA that provides news and information to audiences in the Middle East and North Africa through television, radio and digital properties in Arabic.
The Director identifies priorities, develops plans, and executes all MBN media relations, external outreach, and marketing activities approved by MBN leadership to raise brand awareness and ensure MBN programming is promoted and distributed effectively
The primary duties and responsibilities of the Director of Strategic Communications & Marketing include, but are not limited to:
Developing and managing a comprehensive communications and marketing plan that will proactively represent MBN brands, including establishment of benchmarks to regularly measure the plan’s effectiveness.
Engaging traditional marketing and media outlets as well as social media to best disseminate organizational messages and raise brand awareness. Identify perceptions of MBN brands and propose strategies and tactics to overcome misconceptions and develop strengths.
Directing all communications staff and functions and advise senior staff on communications issues and activities. Prepare staff for media interactions.
Directing all marketing staff and functions, manage external promotion activities and identify placement opportunities in domestic and Arab media to promote brands and distribute programming.
Establishing and maintain strong relationships with relevant opinion journalists and reporters as well as with relevant think tanks and academic institutions with interests in public diplomacy and international broadcasting.
Maintaining awareness of Arabic language broadcast media and regional digital trade industry trends to ascertain and track latest developments in the industry and advise senior MBN leadership on likely effects to MBN’s current and future market position.
Identifying relevant conferences, seminars and symposia that provide opportunities to discuss programming – evaluate the benefits of MBN participation.
Assessing congressional interest in Middle East broadcasting. Propose visits and contacts with Congressional offices and provide information as required. Maintain contact with BBG Congressional liaison and MBN congressional correspondents to ensure collaboration.
Candidates are required to have:
A minimum of 10 years of experience in communications and/or marketing.
At least a B.A/B.S. in related fields. Graduate degree preferred.
Knowledge and understanding of current political, economic and social conditions affecting MBN’s target region
Demonstrated ability to exercise judgment and discretion in evaluating and presenting corporate image and accomplishments
Knowledge of the media environment in the Middle East.
Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing in English and Arabic.
Demonstrated ability to effectively manage human and financial resources.
Knowledge of the Middle East and experience of living and working in the Middle East preferred.

MBN is an equal opportunity employer committed to workforce diversity.

Title: Vice President, Public Affairs
Post_Date: # an unknown date more than 30 days ago
Description:
Vice President, Public Affairs

Organization Edelman

Practice Area Public Affairs


In our NY Corporate and Public Affairs practice, we’re a team of 130+ dedicated professionals including former city, state, and federal government employees, philanthropic experts, journalists, MBAs, lawyers, and integrated communications marketing experts including planners and creatives. We’ve worked with many of NYC’s iconic organizations across the nonprofit, philanthropic, government, education, corporate, and real estate sectors. We support clients to execute campaigns that enhance their credibility on an issue and influence audience perception and actions through media relations, digital and influencer engagement and more. We develop positioning programs that empower an organization to get its message across in a meaningful and impactful way.
Overview of the Role
Edelman is seeking a Vice President of Public Affairs as a member of the firm’s Public Affairs & Advocacy practice, which works with Fortune 500 companies, governments, large nonprofits and foundations to advance issues, shape public opinion and build movements. We work on issues ranging from affordability in higher education to advancements in public transportation to A.I. in health care. We have led behavior change campaigns to increase recycling as well as to empower women in the workforce. We manage international events for clients, including briefings at the United Nations and at the World Economic Forum in Davos. Our clients look to us for help with integrated marketing including strategic communications planning, executive visibility, strategic counsel on influencers, government relations and earned and digital media.
Some successful past campaigns led by this practice include work for WNBA, Chobani, the MTA and the Rockefeller Foundation.
The Vice President should be a seasoned leader with a strong communications/integrated marketing background in either/or non-profit, education, NGO, foundation and/or communications agency with a proven track record of success. They must possess an entrepreneurial spirit and have the capability to manage multiple, simultaneous assignments, and the ability to manage internal and external (client) expectations.
As a strategic thinker, they will apply a multi-channel media mindset to all client work and have an impressive sense of storytelling. They will oversee the creation of multi-media strategies that factor in social and paid opportunities, partnering effectively with internal content creators as well as outside agencies. The VP should demonstrate the ability to provide sound counsel and recommendations on how the business is operated with confidence.
As a member of the Public Affairs leadership team, they will demonstrate the skills and behaviors needed to build culture, up-level client work, expand our collective capability and drive growth. They not only must be a big-picture thinker, but also able to turn big ideas into action and demonstrate superior communication skills, charisma and executive presence. They must be eager to learn and evolve personally, and undaunted by change or complexity. The VP will work with your colleagues across Corporate and Public Affairs as in close partnership with your peers across the agency including our Digital, Planning and Creative teams.
The VP must have a proven background in communications, with people management, business development and budget management. They must have a strong understanding of how to communicate with teams and work from both client and agency perspectives and have a track record of leading profitable programs that have advanced client business goals. The VP must have experience successfully managing resources and budgets as well as helping win new business. They must be team focused, possess strong leadership qualities and be capable of effectively managing a team, including building the earned media skills of other members of the team. We're looking for a driven professional, who can provide expert and creative client counsel, while inspiring and leading teams.
Core Responsibilities

Counsel teams and clients on media relations strategies for an array of accounts; simultaneously juggling multiple projects and issues
Assist in development of creative platforms to account teams to increase effectiveness/impact of media and communications campaigns
Expertly counsel clients based on broad communications landscape and business goals; take immediate action on client feedback
Manage strategic process of pitching stories and/or responding to media inquiries
Be a consumer of news – help identify media trends/interests, what “works” with top media
Lead client meetings and participate new business presentations, when appropriate
Demonstrate advanced writing skills and supervise writing of others
Set and lead integrated traditional and social programs
Assist account team and counsel client on last minute media issues/opportunities (both proactive and reactive)
In-depth communication with a variety of national and local media on behalf of clients; maintain key media contacts
Pitch national print and broadcast media
Propose and provide strategic media analysis and counsel to clients and target audiences
Generate ideas for media outreach/strategy; provide media strategy to new business proposals and at clients’ requests
Capitalize on, and contribute to, the Edelman global network to serve and grow business
Lead staff by mentoring, motivating, coaching, consistently providing feedback, holding them accountable and conducting their reviews and overseeing their professional development
Build strong and lasting relationships with clients and operate as day to day internal and/or external client contact as appropriate
Lead the research, planning and development of comprehensive media relations programs and new business pitches, along with the Vice President and Senior Vice President
Display superior presentation skills including confidence in presenting to clients
Identify opportunities to develop business with existing clients (including cross-selling)
Lead operational and financial performance of account teams, ensuring quality work, effective processes and that client requests are handled in timely and strategic fashion





Qualifications

Have a bachelor’s degree in a related field
8 or more years or experience in one or a combination of non-profit, NGO’s, Education, Foundations and/or agency and/or news outlet
Must be able to demonstrate excellent storytelling skills, and provide sound, level-appropriate media counsel with all levels of internal client contacts
Excellent leadership skills
Have a track record of leading profitable programs that have advanced client business goals
Must have strong contacts and working relationships with local and national news media, understanding of basic television production and video terminology. Previous experience with agency and/or media outlet is preferred
Ability to write strategic media plans and a variety of media materials with limited oversight
Experience managing launches, celebrity campaigns, milestone announcements, media events, participate in desk-side briefings, etc.
High awareness of current events
Proven ability to explain technical portion to client in an easy manner
Expert in knowledge of TV, radio, print, and online media, in addition to working knowledge of online and social media platforms
Must possess a broad understanding of all facets of media relations and marketing communications, a strong background of pitching and winning new business, and experience managing budgets
The candidate should have a demonstrated history of providing high-level, strategic counsel; creative programs; quality outcomes, and; superior customer service to clients.
Must have the ability to assess and understand complex situations and quickly distill the information for both the client and media. In addition, he/she must be team-focused and demonstrate strong leadership qualities
A long-standing track record of developing and executing successful media relations programs with an agency or as an industry practitioner is critical
Be a superb people manager and have experience successfully managing resources and budgets as well as helping win new business
Be entrepreneurial and professional and have the confidence necessary to manage a team
An advanced degree is a plus
Measuring Success
All Edelman staff create their performance goals in partnership with their supervisor and undergo an annual 360-degree review process. The VP will be evaluated on skill and behavioral competencies, with hard and soft measures including (but not limited to) revenue growth, personal leadership style, innovation and creativity, strategic thinking, contributions to NY Corporate and Public Affairs culture and team retention rates.

About Us

Edelman is a leading global communications marketing firm that partners with many of the world's largest and emerging businesses and organizations, helping them evolve, promote and protect their brands and reputations. Among its many honors, the firm was awarded the Cannes Lions Grand Prix for PR, named one of 2018 "Agencies to Watch" by Advertising Age and "Global Agency of the Year" by both the Homes Report and PRWeek, and cited five times by Glassdoor as one of the "Best Places to Work." Edelman owns specialty firms Edelman Intelligence (research) and United Entertainment Group (entertainment, sports, lifestyle).

Take a peek behind the scenes of our US operation at https://edelman.us. You may also click here to view a short video about life at Edelman.

Edelman is an equal opportunity employer of all protected classes, including veterans and individuals with disabilities.

Title: Principal Product Manager – Genomics
Description:
Desired: AWSLoad BalancingJob Description
Do you have passion for how the cloud can accelerate innovation for organizations of all shapes and sizes? At Amazon Web Services (AWS), we are obsessed with helping customers revolutionize the way they build and run their applications, helping them bring their ideas to market faster and at a lower cost. That is whether they are making a website, delivering mobile apps, training machine learning models, powering virtual worlds or sequencing the human genome. Our platform provides convenient access to an extensive selection of compute and related networking services, from EC2, Elastic Container Service and Lambda, to Virtual Private Cloud, Direct Connect and PrivateLink. Enterprises can migrate any workload to the cloud and integrate different systems with a range of configurable, resource-optimized instance types, Batch computing, Elastic Load Balancing and Autoscaling.

Do you have a knack for driving high-impact product and go to market strategies? Do you have a successful track record of taking products from concept to launch and monetization? Are you one of those rare technologists as comfortable working with engineering teams as you are talking with a journalist? Consider joining the AWS Product Management team!

As principal product manager for genomics, you will serve as a senior member of the Industry & ISV solutions product management team and own the product roadmap, B2B positioning and go to market success for a set of the genomics research and clinical services. You will define, price, and package capabilities to address customer needs with particular focus on driving growth of workloads such as high performance computing, machine/deep learning and big data analytics. You will get to work in a large-scale business that most AWS customers use, and have a big impact every day.

Here are other qualities we desire in an product leader:

Be great fun to work with. At AWS, we have a credo of “Work hard. Have fun. Make history”. In this role, you will love what you do, and instinctively know how to make work fun. You will be dynamic and creative, and willing to take on any challenge, work across teams and make a big impact.

Enjoy communicating with customers and partners. You will have a passion for helping customers of all shapes and sizes, from hot start-ups to established enterprises understand how our platform can help take their cloud adoption to the next level.

Have an unbridled passion for technology. In 2017, AWS comprised more than 90 services, and we are continuing to innovate at a rapid pace. The ideal candidate will be passionate about technology and helping marry the most complex technical concepts into coherent solution value propositions that make business sense to customers and partners.

Be a role model for boundary-less collaboration. You will work hand-in-hand with many internal and external stakeholders to translate market insight into features and roadmaps; support product marketing to develop messaging and promotional content, drive product launches and adoption programs; and enable business development, solution architecture, sales and partners.

Possess a hybrid, results-oriented skill-set. While the ideal candidate is highly capable doing the inbound activities involved in building great products, you can focus your energy outbound as well. You are comfortable hands-on in the trenches executing on deliverables as needed to grow your products.

Roles and Responsibilities

Develop product and solution requirements, working backwards from the customer.
Identify target market segments, segment sizing and ideal B2B customer targets, and design forward-thinking positioning approaches for each segment

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Communication Director
Earth Day Network – Washington D.C.

Job Description:

Earth Day Network (EDN) staff are responsible for articulating and contributing to an inspired vision for the organization; taking projects experience; listening and working as a team to bring ideas from concept to lift-off to completion; learning and adapting from new ideas; building relationships to bridge differences and find common ground with people inside and outside of the organization; and communicating effectively, orally, and in writing.

EDN seeks a full-time Communication Director to serve as an integral member of the management team. EDN manages Earth Day initiatives worldwide as well as works year-round on environmental policy and other campaigns and programs. EDN is preparing for Earth Day’s 50th Anniversary in 2020. The Communication Director will be responsible for the development and execution of EDN’s communication strategy for our year-round programs, Earth Day 2019, and for our 50th anniversary, which will be held in 192 countries. The Director is responsible for media advocacy, media partnerships, digital advocacy, thought leadership, organizational/issue visibility, and communication strategies.

The Communication Director will set communication goals and priorities for the organization and evaluate outcomes and results to inform future work. The Director will also be responsible for more than executing campaigns. The Communication Director will serve as the point-person for developing and implementing communication initiatives and activities that promote awareness of and participation in Earth Day events as well as awareness of and partnership with Earth Day Network. These initiatives and activities include campaigns (e.g., print, web, social media, broadcast, etc.), events, corporate responsibility programs, and sponsorships.

Responsibilities:

Develop and execute integrated strategic communication plans to advance EDN’s mission, broaden awareness of EDN’s work, and increase the visibility of the organization worldwide.
Work with press around the world to ensure that EDN’s brand, message, and substantive goals are communicated.
Produce EDN’s campaign and program materials ensuring brand consistency and messaging.
Identify appropriate channels for stories and pitches and maintain meaningful relationships with journalists, producers, bookers, bloggers, and social media outlets.
Set departmental communication goals and objectives, and track and assess performance of department and staff.
Build and maintain a global media contact database.
Oversee and ensure brand consistency across publications, the website, and social media.
Coordinate and create communication thought leadership content.
Work with our digital team to develop and implement a robust social media and email plan for EDN worldwide.
Work with the team to coordinate internal and external communication opportunities and solutions and define and execute appropriate strategies to support them.
Oversee EDN’s website and work with digital team to keep content updated, accurate, and timely.
Create and oversee communication materials as assigned.
Desired Skills & Experience:

A belief in the mission of Earth Day Network.
At least 5-7 years professional experience in a communication management role, including press relationships, and social media.
Experience working with environmental organizations/issues.
Outstanding organization, time management skills, and a strong attention to detail and grace under pressure.
Excellent problem-solving skills, including an ability to anticipate problems and use judgment appropriately to plan solutions.
Excellent oral, written, and computer skills.
Excellent interpersonal skills and facility working with a diverse group of people.
Integrity and a sense of humor.
How to Apply

Title: Marketing & Communications Program Manager (FULL-TIME)
Description:
As one of the nation’s leading pediatric health care systems, Nemours is committed to providing all children with their best chance to grow up healthy. We offer integrated, family-centered care to more than 300,000 children each year in our pediatric hospitals, specialty clinics and primary care practices in Delaware, Florida, Maryland, New Jersey and Pennsylvania. Nemours strives to ensure a healthier tomorrow for all children – even those who may never enter our doors – through our world-changing research, education and advocacy efforts. At Nemours, our Associates help us deliver on the promise we make to every family we have the privilege of serving: to treat their child as if they were our own.

Nemours is seeking a Marketing & Communications Program Manager (FULL-TIME) to join our team in Jacksonville, Florida.
At Nemours, each Associate plays a vital role in supporting the delivery of world-class pediatric care to the children we serve. The team based at our home office in Jacksonville, Fla. provides essential administrative, financial and technical support to Nemours operations across all locations.

Job Duties
The Marketing & Communication Program Manager is responsible for leading development and implementation of comprehensive, integrated marketing and communication programs for Nemours Children’s Specialty Care operations in North Florida markets. This position services as an extension of the Director of Marketing to cover the full continuum of work and as the primary point of contact between clinical and administrative leadership of Nemours operations in North Florida and the Marketing and Communications department.

Team Management
Facilitates and leads work with multidisciplinary team members including consumer insights, brand marketing, web design, content, physician liaisons, design services, public relations, social media, government relations and community relations to develop and implement approved marketing initiatives
Manages contracted staff
Strategy Development
Manages development and implementation of strategic integrated marketing and communication campaigns for prioritized service lines to support Nemours business objectives in North Florida markets.
Maintains an in-depth understanding of service line goals, and profitability to inform marketing efforts.
Leads planning and execution of integrated campaigns through multiple marketing channels including advertising, earned media, social media and community relations.
Financial Management
Prepares and provides oversight of marketing budgets for assigned service lines and geographies.
Provides ongoing stewardship to insure dollars allocated to marketing activities are optimized throughout the fiscal year.
Monthly monitoring of marketing spend against budget. Ensures invoices are processed correctly and in a timely manner.
Analytical Capabilities
Accesses and interprets data from multiple sources in order to glean insight to inform strategy.
Conducts market analysis utilizing quantitative and qualitative market information to guide the development of differentiated programs, insightful marketing strategies and targeted tactics.
Analyze and report on campaign results including ROI and key performance indicators to evaluate the success of initiatives and guide future efforts.
Project Management
Manages multiple assignments and relationships in two North Florida markets.
Display high competency in project management, working in a fast-paced and complex environment and working under multiple and competing deadlines.
Responsible for end-to-end campaign management including: establishing campaign objectives and strategies, identifying marketing channels, developing content, tracking progress and measuring success using data to analyze performance of campaign against key performance indicators.
Tactical Execution
Proactively manages work with internal departments as well as external vendors to ensure all campaign activities are implemented on time and within budget.
Maintains creative oversight of marketing materials including adherence to brand standards
Client Management
Serves as the primary point of contact in Marketing & Communications for clinical and administrative leadership of Nemours Children’s Specialty Care operations in Jacksonville and Pensacola.
Provides consultation on marketing, communication, public relations and social media best practices.
Collaborates with service line administration and physician leaders to identify growth objectives and marketing needs for priority programs.
Serves as primary point of contact in Marketing & Communications with affiliated hospitals or community partners in Jacksonville and Pensacola.
Collaborates with Marketing & Communication leadership in partner organizations to develop and implement marketing programs that support the business objectives of both Nemours and its partners.
Earned and Social Media
Identifies opportunities to advance the Nemours brand in social and earned media channels in Pensacola and Jacksonville.
Facilitates production and deployment of content for social and earned media opportunities.
Serves as media relations representative for NCSC, Pensacola and NCSC, Jacksonville.
Utilizes a keen sense of what ‘makes’ a story for a wide variety news organizations and a deep understanding of the elements needed to secure the interest of journalists in order to turn strategic priorities into positive earned media coverage.
Proactively identify issues that may impact the organization’s reputation and facilitates development of communications plans to mitigate situation.
Serve as an organization spokesperson when necessary.
Community Relations
Leads community relations activities for both North Florida markets including vetting sponsorship requests, identifying opportunities to strategically involve Nemours in community activities, and fulfilling requirements of sponsorships. Tracks and reports out the return on investment for all community relations investments.
This position description is not intended to be all inclusive. The Associate will also perform other reasonably related business duties as assigned by the immediate supervisor and other management as required.
Job Requirements
Bachelor's Degree required. Master's Degree preferred.
Minimum of five (5) + years experience required.
Experience in healthcare marketing and project management preferred.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office products including PowerPoint.
Strong written and oral communication skills with the ability to actively listen and respond in a timely manner.


Our dedication to professionals who are dedicated to children frequently earns Nemours a spot on the list of top workplaces in the communities we serve. Our Associates enjoy comprehensive benefits, including our unique “Bridge to a Healthy Future” pediatric health plan, an integrated wellness program, opportunities for professional growth, and much more. As an equal opportunity employer, Nemours focuses on the best-qualified applicants for our openings.
